title: Bea Borres calls out basher of her baby, urges loved ones not to spread her photos
desc: Bea Borres called out a basher of her baby, Victoria Hope, who had left a negative comment soon after the former posted about her on social media.

title: Three killed, several injured in Yaya-Kawangware road crash
desc: The crash occurred at Bangladesh area, near the Kawangware–Yaya route, leaving several passengers injured.

title: ONGC, Oil India shares jump up to 10% to new record highs as oil prices rise
desc: Oil prices are rising amid supply concerns after a severe winter storm disrupted US crude output and exports. Additionally, rising tensions in the Middle East are also supporting prices.

title: Hundreds stage protest vs China's actions in West PH Sea
desc: Around 200 protesters from the Filipinos Do Not Yield (FDNY) Movement and allied groups held a rally outside the Chinese Embassy in Makati City on Wednesday, January 28, condemning what they described as China’s ongoing aggression in the West Philippine Sea (WPS), according to a report by RH Jece...

title: off' literary festival, Constellations, to go ahead in lieu of Writers' Week
desc: A community literary festival will go ahead in the wake of the cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week, but those involved say it is not a replacement for the original event.

title: ‘Abhorrent and heinous’: Bedbug bites cause mayhem at op shop
desc: A Daylesford shop almost had to close for good after a donation resulted in bedbugs running up the arms of a volunteer.

title: Students don't learn, teachers are 'shock absorbers'
